Public Member Functions

DdMd::AtomStorage Class Reference
Storage

Detailed Description

A container for all the atoms and ghost atoms on this processor.

Definition at line 36 of file AtomStorage.h.

#include <AtomStorage.h>

Member Function Documentation

void DdMd::AtomStorage::readParam ( std::istream &  in) [virtual]

Read parameters, allocate memory and initialize.

Parameters (file format):

  • atomCapacity [int] max number of atoms owned by processor.
  • ghostCapacity [int] max number of ghosts on this processor.
  • totalatomCapacity [int] max number of atoms on all processors.
Parameters:
ininput parameter stream.

Reimplemented from Util::ParamComposite.

Definition at line 75 of file AtomStorage.cpp.

Atom * DdMd::AtomStorage::newAtomPtr ( )

Returns pointer an address available for a new Atom.

This method returns the address of an Atom object that can be used for a new local Atom. It does not add the Atom the the atom set, and so must be followed by a call to addNewAtom() to do this.

Usage: 

 AtomStorage storage;
 Atom*       ptr;

 ptr = storage.newAtomPtr;
 ptr->setId(id);
 // Set other properties of the new Atom.
 storage.addNewAtom();
Returns:
address for new atom.

Definition at line 124 of file AtomStorage.cpp.

Referenced by DdMd::Exchanger::exchangeAtoms().

void DdMd::AtomStorage::addNewAtom ( )

Finalize addition of the most recent new atom.

This method adds the atom that was returned by the most recent call to newAtomPtr to the atom set. The global atom id must be set before calling this function, by calling Atom::setId(int), because the algorithm uses the global id returned by Atom::id().

Definition at line 142 of file AtomStorage.cpp.

Referenced by DdMd::Exchanger::exchangeAtoms().

Atom * DdMd::AtomStorage::addAtom ( int  id)

Add atom with specified global id.

This method adds a new atom to the atom set and returns a pointer to the address of the new atom. It is equivalent to the following, in which storage is an instance of AtomStorage and ptr is an Atom pointer: 

 ptr = storage.newAtomPtr;
 ptr->setId(id);
 storage.addNewAtom();
Parameters:
idglobal index for the new Atom.
Returns:
address for new atom.

Exceptions:
Exceptionif atomPtr is not address of a local Atom.
Parameters:
atomPtrpointer to the atom to be removed

References UTIL_THROW.

Referenced by DdMd::Exchanger::exchangeAtoms().

Atom * DdMd::AtomStorage::newGhostPtr ( )

Returns pointer an address available for a new ghost Atom.

This method returns the address of an Atom object that can be used for a new ghost Atom. It must be followed by a call to addNewGhost(). Usage: 

 AtomStorage storage;
 Atom*       ptr;

 ptr = storage.newGhostPtr;
 ptr->setId(id);
 // Set other properties of the new Atom.
 storage.addNewGhost();
Returns:
address for new ghost atom.

Definition at line 199 of file AtomStorage.cpp.

void DdMd::AtomStorage::addNewGhost ( )

Register the most recent new ghost atom.

This method adds the atom that was returned by the most recent call to newGhostPtr to the ghost atom set. The global atom id must be set before calling this function, by calling Atom::setId(int), because an data structure uses the global id returned by Atom::id().

Definition at line 214 of file AtomStorage.cpp.

Atom * DdMd::AtomStorage::addGhost ( int  id)

Add ghost atom with specified global id.

This method adds a new atom to the ghost atom set and returns a pointer to the address of the new atom. It is equivalent to the following, in which storage is an AtomStorage object and ptr is an Atom pointer: 

 ptr = storage.newGhostPtr;
 ptr->setId(id);
 storage.addNewGhost();
Parameters:
idglobal index for the new Atom.
Returns:
address for new ghost atom.

Parameters:
atomPtrpointer to the ghost atom to be removed

void DdMd::AtomStorage::makeSnapshot ( )

Record current positions of all local atoms and lock storage.

This method stores positions of local atoms and locks the storage, prohibiting addition or removal of atoms or ghosts until clearSnapshot is called.

Definition at line 292 of file AtomStorage.cpp.

Referenced by DdMd::TwoStepIntegrator::run(), DdMd::NvtIntegrator::setup(), DdMd::NveIntegrator::setup(), and DdMd::Integrator::setupAtoms().

void DdMd::AtomStorage::clearSnapshot ( )

Clear previous snapshot.

This method removes the lock imposed by a previous call to makeSnapshot(), allowing changes to atom and ghost sets.

Definition at line 311 of file AtomStorage.cpp.

Referenced by DdMd::TwoStepIntegrator::run(), DdMd::NvtIntegrator::setup(), DdMd::NveIntegrator::setup(), and DdMd::Integrator::setupAtoms().

double DdMd::AtomStorage::maxSqDisplacement ( )

Return max.

squared displacement on this processor since last snapshot.

Note: This is a local operation, and returns only the maximum on this processor.

Throws exception if no valid snapshot is available.

Definition at line 319 of file AtomStorage.cpp.

bool DdMd::AtomStorage::needExchange ( MPI::Intracomm &  communicator,
double  skin 
)

Is exchange of atoms among processors needed?

This method returns true if any atom in the AtomStorage has moved a distance skin/2 or greater since the last snapshot was built. It is a reduce-to-all operation: Must be called on all nodes and returns same result on all nodes.

Parameters:
communicatordomain communicator
skinpair potential skin for pair list
Returns:
true if exchange / reneighboring is needed, false otherwise.

Atom * DdMd::AtomStorage::find ( int  atomId) const

Return pointer to Atom with specified id.

This method returns a pointer to an Atom or ghost Atom with the specified id if it is exists on this processor, or returns a null pointer if the atom does not exist on this processor.

Definition at line 392 of file AtomStorage.cpp.

Referenced by DdMd::GroupStorage< N >::isValid().

template<int N>
int DdMd::AtomStorage::countGroupAtoms ( Group< N > &  group) const

Count the number of atoms in Group and in this AtomStorage.

Preconditions: 1) All atom ids in the Group<N> must be set to valid values, in the range 0 <= atomId(i) < totalAtomCapacity. 2) No ghost atoms may exist in this AtomStorage. The method throws an exception if it finds a ghost atom.

Parameters:
groupGroup<N> object with known atom ids.

Definition at line 536 of file AtomStorage.h.

References DdMd::Group< N >::atomId(), DdMd::Atom::isGhost(), and UTIL_THROW.

template<int N>
int DdMd::AtomStorage::findGroupAtoms ( Group< N > &  group) const

Set handles to atoms in a Group<N> object.

On entry group is a Group<N> object for which the atom ids have been set for all N atoms in the group, but the pointers may not yet have been set. On exit, both pointers and values of atom ownerId are set are set for all atoms that are found in this AtomStorage. Pointers for any atoms that are not found on this storage are set to null values.

Precondition: All atom ids in the Group must be set to values in the range 0 <= atomId(i) < totalAtomCapacity.

Parameters:
groupGroup<N> object with known atom ids.
Returns:
number of atoms found on this processor.

int DdMd::AtomStorage::totalAtomCapacity ( ) const [inline]

Return maximum number of atoms on all processors.

Atom ids are labelled from 0, ..., totalAtomCapacity-1

Definition at line 511 of file AtomStorage.h.

Referenced by DdMd::GroupStorage< N >::isValid(), and DdMd::DdMdConfigIo::readConfig().

void DdMd::AtomStorage::computeNAtomTotal ( MPI::Intracomm &  communicator)

Compute and store the total number of atoms on all processors.

This is an MPI reduce operation. The correct result is stored and returned only on the rank 0 processor. On other processors, the method stores a null value of -1.

Parameters:
communicatorMPI communicator for this system.
Returns:
on master node, return total number of atoms.

Definition at line 475 of file AtomStorage.cpp.

Referenced by DdMd::Exchanger::exchangeAtoms(), DdMd::TwoStepIntegrator::run(), DdMd::OutputTemperature::sample(), DdMd::NvtIntegrator::setup(), DdMd::NptIntegrator::setup(), DdMd::NphIntegrator::setup(), and DdMd::DdMdConfigIo::writeConfig().

int DdMd::AtomStorage::nAtomTotal ( ) const [inline]

On master processor (rank=0), stored value of total number of atoms.

This method should only be called on the master node (rank = 0). The return value is computed by a previous call of computeNAtomTotal.
